data.title: Dollar Index Experiences Short-Term Rise
data.description: The dollar index (DXY) saw a brief increase of 15 points, reaching 97.82. According to ChainCatcher, this movement was reported by Jinshi. The rise in the dollar index reflects ongoing fluctuations in the currency market.

data.title: Rekt Capital: Bitcoin bear market not over, price capped at $68,000
data.description: Rekt Capital analysis indicates that BTC price encountered resistance at the $68,000 trendline and weakened momentum after breaking below $70,000. TradingView data shows that BTC/USD fell by more than 1% on the day, having previously touched the 200-week exponential moving average (EMA) and the all-time high of 2021 at $70,040, but failed to hold. Rekt Capital states that the 200-week EMA has now become a resistance level, and historical data shows that if Bitcoin continues to fall below this level, the price tends to decline further. The liquidity ladder below $69,000 has been exhausted, and the momentum has been lost. Yesterday's rally pushed the price to the previous cycle high and the 12-hour trendline before being retraced. The trend remains clear, and caution is advised. Rekt Capital further points out that the shortest Bitcoin bear market lasted 365 days, and it has currently entered its 140th day, meaning it is not yet time to exit the bear market. Historically, bear markets typically see declines of around 80%, and BTC's largest retracement from its October 2025 high of $126,200 to its 15-month low in February was approximately 53%. (Cointelegraph)

data.title: Twelve suspected insider wallets profited a total of $1.02 million by betting on ZachXBT's alleged insider trading activities.
data.description: According to Lookonchain's monitoring and analysis, 12 wallets suspected of being insider accounts profited a total of 102 million by betting on the ZachXBT project exposed for insider trading. data.title: Treasuries Rise as US Tech Shares Decline
data.description: Treasuries experienced an increase, pushing longer-maturity yields closer to their lowest levels of the year. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting a concurrent downturn in U.S. technology stocks. This movement in the bond market reflects investor sentiment shifting away from equities, particularly in the tech sector, towards safer assets. The decline in tech shares has been a significant factor influencing the bond market, as investors reassess risk amid economic uncertainties. The trend underscores the ongoing volatility in financial markets, driven by fluctuating investor confidence and broader economic conditions.

data.title: FTC and States Sue Walmart Over Alleged Misconduct in Driver Payments
data.description:
The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and several states have filed a lawsuit against Walmart, accusing the retail giant of withholding tips and misrepresenting wages to drivers involved in its Spark delivery program. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the legal action taken against Walmart, which is alleged to have engaged in deceptive practices affecting the compensation of its delivery drivers.

The lawsuit claims that Walmart failed to properly disclose how tips were distributed and allegedly misled drivers about their earnings. The Spark program, which facilitates the delivery of orders to customers, has come under scrutiny for its handling of driver payments.

The FTC and the states involved in the lawsuit are seeking to hold Walmart accountable for these alleged violations, aiming to ensure fair compensation practices for drivers. The legal action underscores ongoing concerns about transparency and fairness in gig economy jobs, where workers often face challenges related to pay and benefits.

Walmart has yet to respond publicly to the allegations, and the case is expected to unfold in the coming months as both sides present their arguments. The outcome of this lawsuit could have significant implications for the retail industry and gig economy workers, highlighting the importance of clear and honest communication regarding wages and tips.

data.title: Workplace Productivity and Fear: A Critical Analysis
data.description: The Long View, institutional investor, posted on X, highlighting the impact of workplace dynamics on productivity and employee morale. The discussion centers around how certain management practices can inadvertently lead to a decline in productivity and foster an environment of fear among employees. This analysis underscores the importance of effective leadership and communication in maintaining a healthy and productive work environment. The insights provided aim to encourage organizations to evaluate their management strategies to ensure they are conducive to employee well-being and organizational success.

data.title: Cuban Authorities Intercept Suspected Terrorist Vessel in Territorial Waters
data.description:
Cuban authorities reported on February 25 that they intercepted a speedboat suspected of engaging in terrorist infiltration activities within Cuban territorial waters. According to Jin10, Cuban President Miguel Díaz-Canel responded on social media, emphasizing that Cuba neither attacks nor threatens any nation. He reiterated Cuba's commitment to defending its sovereignty with determination and resolve against any attempts to undermine its sovereignty and national stability through terrorism and mercenary aggression.

The Cuban Border Guard discovered the speedboat, registered in Florida, USA, illegally entering Cuban waters near Villa Clara Province. A confrontation ensued, resulting in the deaths of four attackers and injuries to six others.

data.title: Canada Sees Surge in Foreign Direct Investment in Fourth Quarter
data.description: Foreign direct investment into Canada experienced a significant increase in the fourth quarter, resulting in the highest annual inflows in 18 years. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the substantial rise in investment activity. This surge underscores Canada's growing appeal to international investors, contributing to a robust economic outlook. The increase in foreign direct investment reflects confidence in Canada's economic stability and potential for growth. The data suggests a positive trend for the Canadian economy, attracting attention from global investors seeking opportunities in the region.

data.title: Axiom Promoter Issues Apology Following Revelations
data.description: Devin, a promoter of Axiom, has issued a public apology after confidently supporting Axiom amidst allegations. According to NS3.AI, Devin had previously urged his followers to wager against any exposure claims on Polymarket, asserting that Axiom was not involved. However, he was caught off guard when ZachXBT disclosed damaging information about Axiom, contradicting his earlier statements.

data.title: Solana Aims to Expand Beyond Europe with New Multicast Functionality
data.description: A former executive from Solana is spearheading efforts to decrease the platform's heavy concentration in Europe by broadening its geographic presence. According to NS3.AI, the initiative includes the introduction of multicast functionality, which is expected to accelerate global cryptocurrency transactions. This strategy draws inspiration from traditional Wall Street trading techniques.

data.title: BNB Drops Below 620 USDT with a Narrowed 0.52% Increase in 24 Hours
data.description: On Feb 26, 2026, 15:23 PM(UTC). According to Binance Market Data, BNB has dropped below 620 USDT and is now trading at 619.669983 USDT, with a narrowed narrowed 0.52% increase in 24 hours.

data.title: Wrexham AFC Faces Potential Financial Loss Due to Argentex Collapse
data.description: Wrexham AFC, the Welsh soccer club owned by Hollywood actors Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney, is facing potential financial losses following the collapse of UK currency brokerage Argentex. Bloomberg posted on X that the club, which is also supported by Apollo, may lose some of its funds held with the brokerage. The situation has raised concerns about the financial stability of the club, which has gained significant attention due to its celebrity ownership. The impact of this development on Wrexham AFC's operations and future plans remains to be seen.

data.title: Binance Research: Bitcoin leverage ratio rises to highest level since November last year, potentially signaling a short-term bottom.
data.description: Binance Research published an article on its X platform stating that Bitcoin leverage has climbed to its highest level since November of last year as the price decline outpaced active deleveraging. The analysis points out that this increase in passive leverage reflects peak market pressure and may indicate an impending short-term bottom. Furthermore, the market is expected to stabilize as deleveraging slows and liquidity consolidates.

data.title: NVIDIA Shares Experience Volatility Following Opening
data.description: NVIDIA's stock opened higher but quickly reversed into negative territory, declining by 3%. Bespoke Investment Group posted on X. This pattern is reminiscent of the previous quarter when NVIDIA shares initially rose by 5% but subsequently fell by 7.8% from the opening to the closing bell. The stock's volatility continues to be a point of interest for investors.

data.title: GEOPOLITICS | U.S. Delays Sale of Lukoil Overseas Assets Amid Ukraine Peace Talks
data.description: The United States is reportedly slowing down the sale of Lukoil's overseas assets, using them as leverage in ongoing peace negotiations with Ukraine. According to Jin10, sources indicate that the decision to delay the asset sale is part of a broader strategy to influence the diplomatic discussions surrounding the conflict in Ukraine. The move highlights the geopolitical complexities involved in the situation, as the U.S. seeks to balance economic interests with diplomatic objectives. The sale of Lukoil's assets, which has been under consideration for some time, is now intertwined with the peace talks, reflecting the intricate relationship between international business dealings and geopolitical negotiations.

data.title: Global Leaders Reevaluate Growth Strategies Amid Shifting Economic Power
data.description: Global leaders are reassessing their approaches to economic growth as power becomes more distributed across various regions. Bloomberg posted on X, highlighting the ongoing discussions among policymakers and economists about adapting to this new landscape. The shift in economic dynamics is prompting countries to explore innovative strategies to maintain competitiveness and foster sustainable development. This reevaluation comes as traditional economic centers face challenges from emerging markets, necessitating a broader perspective on global economic policies. The dialogue underscores the importance of collaboration and adaptability in navigating the complexities of a multipolar economic environment.

data.title: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) will host a roundtable discussion on private market valuation on March 4, focusing on access for retail investors.
data.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has officially announced that it will hold a roundtable discussion on March 4 at its headquarters in Washington, D.C., to discuss private market valuation and responsible retailization. The meeting will be moderated by Brian Daly and streamed live on the SEC’s website. Roundtable topics will include the opportunities and challenges of traditional private assets gradually entering public products, matters that public investors should pay attention to, and the governance challenges and best practices of managers providing exposure to private market assets in response to retail demand.

data.title: Gold prices remained stable as investors awaited the outcome of US-Iran negotiations.
data.description: Gold prices remained stable on Thursday as investors hoped for signals from the US-Iran talks regarding whether geopolitical risks could be eased. "Gold and silver are attempting to break through resistance levels at $5200 and $90 respectively, but have failed to sustain gains so far this week. A geopolitical agreement in the near future could increase downside risks," said Larzan Hillar, market analyst at FOREX.com, in a report. Peter Grant, vice president and senior metals strategist at Zaner Metals, said, "People are paying close attention to the progress of this third round of negotiations. But regardless, I think there is still considerable uncertainty in the market." (Jinshi)

data.title: STOCKS | U.S. Airline Stocks Rise as Oil Prices Decline
data.description: U.S. airline stocks experienced a notable increase following a drop in oil prices. According to Jin10, American Airlines saw a rise of 4.5%, United Airlines increased by 3.5%, and JetBlue Airlines climbed by 3%. The decline in oil prices is providing relief to the airline industry, which often faces challenges due to fluctuating fuel costs. This trend is contributing to positive investor sentiment in the aviation sector.
